get.description:
Search for verses, chapters, juz, pages, and other Quran content. This is the primary search API used by Quran.com.

## Use Cases

### 1. Command Bar / Search-as-you-type (Quick Mode)
Used in Quran.com's command bar for instant navigation. Returns both navigational results (chapters, juz, pages) and verse matches.

```
GET /v1/search?mode=quick&query=fatiha&navigationalResultsNumber=5&versesResultsNumber=10
```

### 2. Search Results Page (Advanced Mode)
Used for the full search results page with pagination and detailed verse results.

```
GET /v1/search?mode=advanced&query=mercy&page=1&size=20&translation_ids=131,20
```

### 3. Search with Exact Matching
For precise search queries, use exact_matches_only in advanced mode.

```
GET /v1/search?mode=advanced&query=الرحمن&exact_matches_only=1
```

## Response Structure
- **navigation**: Quick links to chapters, juz, pages matching the query
- **verses**: Individual verse matches with optional highlighting
- **pagination**: Standard pagination info for result sets

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Search mode - quick for navigation/autocomplete, advanced for detailed results

parameters.name: filter_translations
parameters.description: Comma-separated translation IDs to filter by

parameters.name: exact_matches_only
parameters.description: Return only exact matches (advanced mode only)

parameters.name: get_text
parameters.description: Include full verse text in results

parameters.name: navigationalResultsNumber
parameters.description: Number of navigational results to return (quick mode only)

parameters.name: versesResultsNumber
parameters.description: Number of verse results to return (quick mode only)

parameters.name: indexes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of indexes to search (quick mode only)

400.description: Invalid search parameters - check required fields mode and query

401.description: Unauthorized - missing or invalid x-auth-token header

403.description: Forbidden - token does not have the required "search" scope

info.title: Quran.Foundation Search API
info.description:
Quran.Foundation Search API provides programmatic access to search Quran content including verses, chapters, juz, pages, and translations. This is distinct from user-specific data like notes and bookmarks provided by [User-related APIs](/docs/category/user-related-apis).

## How to get access

We are using OAuth2 flows to authenticate and authorize requests. To get started, you need to [get an access token](/docs/tutorials/oidc/getting-started-with-oauth2#obtaining-oauth-20-client-credentials) to make requests to our APIs. Then follow the steps mentioned [here](/docs/tutorials/oidc/getting-started-with-oauth2). The required scope is [`search`](/docs/user_related_apis_versioned/scopes#search).

x-auth-token.name: x-auth-token
x-auth-token.description: The JWT access token required for accessing the endpoints.

next_page.description: Next page number, null if on last page

result_type.description: Type of result - determines how to navigate/display

key.description: Key for navigation (chapter number, verse key like "1:1", juz number, etc.)

name.description: Display name of the result (chapter name, verse text preview, etc.)

isArabic.description: True if the name contains Arabic text

isTransliteration.description: True if the result is from transliteration matching

navigation.description: Quick navigation results (chapters, juz, pages, etc.)

verses.description: Verse results matching the search query
